intro: Lissochilus lisowskii, commonly known as the Andean bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of the Andes. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, blue or violet flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine environments, thriving in cool, moist conditions. Its leaves are usually lance-shaped and covered in a fine, velvety texture. Due to its unique appearance and habitat, it is often cultivated in botanical gardens for its ornamental value.
